Reviews.Title: “Consistent, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: Kay L
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here I had found a deal online. When I went to check in, the employee informed me of a better deal and saved me even more. From then on I stay no where else and they are consistenly helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean and freshly restocked(sheets and all). It is in a sketchy party of town, BUT once I'm in the room, I don't feel like it. Plus, a few blocks away(no joke, straight down 7th)there are plenty of places to eat, explore and becomes a much nicer area within blocks!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From This Place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Graygab1
Reviews.Content: The lobby will deceive you when checking in because it's very nice. Sure, this place is historic with wonderful old Hollywood detailing, but once I set foot off the elevator to my floor the place became a run down, dirty, dingy, stinky, outdated, filthy, disgusting, musty old mess. I felt completely unsafe here. The first room on the 11th floor was really, really, really, really bad so I asked for a "better" room. The guy at the front desk then changed me to a room on the 14th floor and it was only just "really bad." Both rooms had stains on the carpet, dust on the fixtures, and the aura of doom. My instincts told me to check out. I didn't even want to stay long enough to take pictures. Just trust me on this one. The cab driver who took me to a Marriott around the corner stated that most of the occupants actually "live" at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for Location”
Reviews.Author: jm67
Reviews.Content: I hadn't read amy reviews whatsoever of this place before I got there, I had just been driving for like 8 hours, was tired and it was getting really late. I had originally planned on staying at some cheap Rodeway Inn or something that was out in some desolate industrial area and had a beyond rude Indian guy there who tried to raise the rate up to 89 a night from the original 59.. I just wanted to not drive around anymore because I started seeing more and more Florencia 13 gang markings and figured I'm going the wrong direction lol. Every other place we called that night wanted like 79 or 89, it was pretty rediculous. So I called this place and figured for $59 it would be a total dump but being downtown and not in some gang turf, I didnt care. I was really surprised it has some look of elegance in the lobby, and feel of an old historic hotel. The room was on the 14th floor, and the window opens up the entire way. Not something normally seen at high story hotels. It had a very close view of downtown skyline being there on 7th street. The shower required that you be about 3 ft 11 or less and one leg half length of the other in order to really be comfortable in it. It was slanted halfway at the bottom and 2 different heights and the shower was chest level standing on the lower area of tub. Other than that, hey it was a room in a central location close to everything, at a very low price. If youre looking for hotel luxury and a place just to lounge at all day, then this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “That wasn't too bad.”
Reviews.Author: Thecutetraveller
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe how people can be so nasty and irrational when giving feedbacks. I have read tons of negative reviews of this hotel ahead of my visit and that made me nervous of course. I have lowered my expectations then in order not to get disappointed as soon as I get the first-hand experience of what most people refer to as awful service and bad stay in this hotel. First and foremost, the value is unbeatable. It is very reasonable and considering that most holidays are all about outdoor activities,you don't really need a huge, grandiose and elegant hotel - you will only use it for sleeping and a bit of shower. Apart from the price, I thought most of the staff were very pleasant too. Juliana, the hotel manager, was exceptionally nice even before my visit as I had loads of questions through email. The concierge and the housekeepers were also friendly, warm and welcoming. The state of the rooms, I have no issues with. I stayed in a Queen Deluxe room which perhaps may have explained why the state looks perfect and flawless. Should I have stayed in one of the standard rooms, then maybe I could have spotted something else. Nevertheless, it was a good hotel to stay if you are just after the touristy spots. The neighbourhood was my only problem. If you're looking to do daytime activities, this is ok for you it if you are looking for a fun and entertaining night life, I wouldn't recommend not just this hotel but the whole of downtown as the whole environment is dodgy, full of scary homeless people who, any minute, might just grab and hurt you. I might just be exaggerating things but that's how it feels in evening. But I guess it is out of the hotel's control.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: IroMac
Reviews.Content: This is a very bad neighborhood, we felt unsafe at night walking to the hotel. The room was not very clean, the internet didn't work for about 2 days and overall they didn't care about maintenance. This hotel is just being squeezed out by the investors before closing down. Oh, and the (american) breakfast buffet is very very very fat and not really fresh.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin K
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accommodating! It was extremely clean. The beds were comfortable. It is in a GREAT location. I reallyl enjoyed my time in LA :)

Reviews.Title: “dont trust the pictures”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump and recently there was a newstory on cbs sacramento call kurtis section about it. Thank goodness, i cancelled the reservation i had. I tried contacting the hotel via their facebook and twitter but they quickly deleted my questions and the link i posted asking about a response to the allegations. Obviously this hotel tries the bait and switch tactics by posting a picture of their best room and then all other rooms are completely run down.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Filthy”
Reviews.Author: 671gecko
Reviews.Content: Unless you enjoy the sensation of having a roach crawl across your face, you won't stay here. I thought I was dreaming, but when I turned on the light, I saw several scurry away from my nightstand and table. I called the front desk about it and they reacted as if it was regular occurrence. No attempt to move me to another room or anything. Other things that bothered me about this place was the terrible customer service at the front desk, the missing knobs on my air conditioning unit, and the old, torn linens and towels.

Reviews.Title: “It's actually alright...”
Reviews.Author: Jay W
Reviews.Content: So much hatred towards this place. Nice staff. Big room. Great view over Downtown. Everything is definitely ok. BUT. It is simple. It is basic. All this talk of muggers etc..? What? Grow some and then enjoy this city. Count yourself lucky you are here. Enjoy that moment. Great base for DT and the subway is 7 minutes walk away, which means it is all yours. Overall; It is simple (nice room/clean bathroom/helpful staff). But if you want it all, walk down the road and spend a few hundred bucks more.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to be in the 21st century!!”
Reviews.Author: P J
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not very clean...though they have worked on "some" remodeling. If you expect HDTV and/or ESPN (for Monday Night Football) forget it!!! They seem to not to want to pay the price for the customer....also Some of the TV channels are doubled or so snowy they are not watchable!!! I've not yet eaten any food served at this hotel but if you like dinning with a "Herb-A-Life" meeting, then by all means check in during the week and you'll get a front row seat. All in all....this is a get a little less than you pay for kind of Hotel. But if you're really on a budget...it will serve you well...plenty of fast food in the area and the taco truck across the street is very good. BTW....I've live in this hotel for over 2 years and changes are very hard coming.

Reviews.Title: “We hated and will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: Carmen Consuelo D
Reviews.Content: Ghostly, overused linen and pillows, scary neighborhood, no security, no food available, no restaurant, only a small vending machine for dry snacks, no soda or water vening machine.

Reviews.Title: “once a nice place...today just a dump”
Reviews.Author: adrianmiami
Reviews.Content: certainly once a nice establishment.today situated in lttle mexico or guatemala or whatever the area is called. you are afraid to go outside the hotel ...it is like being in central america. very dirty and shabby. gangland. muggers.police sirens any time. the hotel inside is pleasant and satisfactory.70 us is okay but the staff is unprofessional and not helpful in anything. the rooms are moist and smell. i changed them 3 times. the magnetic cards dont work, the carpet is a 100 years old and yhe whole place should be a museum. anything positive? maybe ...it is close to the banking district. not nice...avoid it. and dont go out at night !!! small rooms. old tv sets (no lcds:) i changed it as soon as i could to the wilshire hotel.same price and a million times better.really!!! just a waste of money . non smoking rooms smell of tobacco. great !

Reviews.Title: “Grotesque”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTracee
Reviews.Content: I typically book the hotels when traveling, but my boyfriend actually booked this one before we met. We checked in and 20 minutes later we were headed to the Hilton Checkers nearby. Check-in: I became suspicious during check-in when we were told a required $50 deposit could be made in cash. The elevator sounded as if it would stop working at any moment. Thank goodness it didn't because our room was on the 11th floor of this disgusting place. There is no way I could relax in a place like this. The Room: The hallway reeked of bug spray. We did not want any critters crawling into our things so we kept our bags closed. There were two twin beds pushed together with a set of dirty full/queen linens covering them, as if we wouldn't notice the difference. The carpet was sticky, the furniture was worn and dirty and the bathroom was tiny, grimey and had beige tiles. We never even sat down because everything about the room was extremely grotesque. I was on the phone with Hilton within 10 minutes of entering the room.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty! We would never return!”
Reviews.Author: Sondra94
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not clean. There was mold on the bathroom tile in the shower. We were in a "smoke free" room that reeked of smoke. The breakfast fare consisted of stale doughnuts, apples, and single servings of cereal. We certainly would not dine there after seeing the lack of standards for cleanliness of the rooms. We asked for change to tip the bellhop, and were told "no".

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised !!!!”
Reviews.Author: lolasandiego966
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and was a little scared as to what I might find. But I was very surprised as to how clean the room was and how pleasant the hotel staff was. kudos to Manny the bellman, he gave us exact directions to where we needed to go. the room was large (oversized) the amenities were great, the makeup mirror was awesome and put to good use. I will surely recommend this hotel to my when they want to stay in L. A. MAYFAIR YOU ROCK

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Stay away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PinkNblu
Reviews.Content: We booked the suite w/ 2 beds & separate living area for $102 thinking that we would get a better room. We walked in, smelling smoke- curtains were filthy & had mold, ac was not working carpet turned my toddlers feet black in 2 mins. It was so late as we slowly noticed the defects & we were tired to we decided to sleep & speak w the mgr the next day. In the morning, my son & I woke up congested / coughing. I spoke to a nice lady mgr ( julianne ) who upgraded us to the presidential suite due to the complaint i haf and rate i paid. The pres suite was much better but the hot& cold shower was acting up, sink/faucet was rusty & my toddlers feet became black ( he refuses to wear slippers on carpet, this is what he's use too ). The continental bfast had flies around it & not even a mediocher attendant- she was hispanic & did not have even the most basic service training!! This hotel needs to get all the carpets thoroughly shamppooed- this is a health hazzard. They need to cleqn the airducts/ ac-- another health hazzard./ remove that step from the shower & replace the sink. The area is bad but its got good proximity to downtown spots. This property can be great if better management was put into place. The GM or whoever the decision maker is for the property should not even work for a dollar store: should not work for a mcdonalds or at all!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING and Looks like a hunted hotel NO JOKE!!”
Reviews.Author: livenbee
Reviews.Content: Me and my best friend came to LA from San Diego to go to the Rihanna concert on the 28th and may i dsay HISTORIC was the right name for this place the room was bnasty the hotel looks 1920 out dated as soon as we saw the room we thought it was a joke. i had called before coming to see if we could get a upgrade and they gave us one from our 2 double beds to 2 queens but this didnt llook like any pgrade. I was afraid their were bed bugs in the room i had to ask if they have cleaned or sprayed for them but the front desk didnt give me a straight answer. GUESSING THEY HAVE HISTORY OF HAVING THEM GO FIGURE! We planned on getting wasted at the concert so we wouldn't come back in the dark and not remeber where we fell asleep (i dont really drink either) there was suppose to be continential breakfast but buy the looks of the hotel room i doubt the kitchen looks any better so we rushed outa there the next morning to go to 6flags even though they didnt open until 10 . NEVER EVER AGAIN! FYI: DOWN TOWN LA WAS NOT REALLY A GOOD AREA, AT LEAST THE AREA AROUND THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Philw91
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be a 2 star but dosent deserve a 1!! We have been traveling around the states for a month and this hotel is in a shocking location it's dirty rooms include: paper thin Walls, (parties next door until 3am, hotel staff did nothing about) broken tv and coffee machine, terrible shower, wallpaper coming off Walls and a bed like concrete, an absolute shocking stay! Please keep away!!

Reviews.Title: “The most horrible hotel I've ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: GailaHorne
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, I took my daughter, and her friends to the Anime expo. My sister came down to keep me company. I have never, in my 55 years of life, spent over $180.00 for two rooms, and been subjected to two horribly disgusting rooms! To close the door in room 1232, you have to climb into the bathtub to close the door. The wall paper in the room is peeling off, the carpet, well, let's just say, you would not want to walk on it with your bare feet, and the AC was completely useless. The other room, 1233 was not much better, their sink leaked & squished water. And after you check in, you find that you have to pay an additional $10 for parking!!! PLEASE, DO NOT EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, not disappointed, but was not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: AprilGrant
Reviews.Content: I checked in late and parked on the top level. There weren't really any signs to direct me where to go. Once I got to my room, I went to charge my phone, I realized one outlet didn't work, the outlet behind the night stand was non-existent and the clock nor the lights were plugged in (just hanging behind), and the one working outlet seemed to have an extension cord. The carpet was filthy, I didn't want to take off my shoes. The bathroom was tiny! I basically had to climb over the sick to get to the bathtub (although the bathroom was very clean).

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be decieving, the elegance stops at the elevator”
Reviews.Author: aussiechick3564
Reviews.Content: We picked the Mayfair as it was cheap, close to our convention, and had a restaurant on site - well two out of three aint bad. On check the clerk gave me an info pack that said the restaurant was closed for dinner and lunch due to refurbishment but was open for breakfast. When we went to go to breakfast on our second morning we were disappointed that despite the check in info the restaurant was CLOSED. The foyer and entrance are stunning - we were very happy until we alighted from the elevator - the elegance stopped in the foyer. The 15th floor is VERY hot, the only saving grace was the windows opened and we had a view of the Hollywood sign. The rooms are very much in need of a good refurb, though the beds were clean and comfortable. Don't get conned into the tour they advertise at the concierge desk - it's a rip off and bloody boring. Also beware that when you order a cab - the concierge may call a mate - with a car - not an LA registered cab - which has two people in the front - for two females there was no way we were getting into it and made them call us a proper cab. It is close to the cleaners and they do a fabulous wash and fold service. The neighborhood is not very safe after dark - but two blocks down was Downtown LA - walking after dark is not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Under-rated hotel, location problematic”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: I may not have extensive knowledge of L.A. hotels, but I feel the lowly ranking of this property on TA is unwarranted. Stayed here for ten nights in a balmy February and found it to be on the good side of acceptable. The location is not optimal - Downtown for starters and on a street that is dimly lit at night to boot. You also have to walk a bit to get to the restaurants on Figueroa and 7th. But I have few gripes with the hotel experience itself, rooms were spacious and comfy and we slept very well. In room movies were competitively priced and we caught up on a few new releases! The hotel would benefit from having a proper bar or entertainment space, lounging around reception isn't exactly exciting. Downtown isn't the place to go for nightlife anyhow. I would have preferred a buffet breakfast than a la carte as I like to load up on holidays. The quality of the food was good however, some nice Mexican spins on American staples. It is possible to get keen prices in this hotel if you shop around. There are good restaurants on Figueroa St: Engine 27, Ciudad, Morton's but you'll be taking long taxi rides if you wish to pub/club after dark

Reviews.Title: “Nice value; no problem for me”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: I didn't feel the hotel was in "a bad neighborhood" od Dodgy or sketchy area." I saw families, women walking alone, etc. after dark and I never felt uncomfortable walking from the 7th street Metro. My home neighborhood can be dicier than this at times. I must say only two things I read in previous reviews rang true: The queen bed is actually two twins pushed together and the hot water in the shower was tempermental. I had a nice stay and secure room for a good price. The front desk clerks were attentive and friendly. I couldn't have asked for much more. This is an older hotel with quirks and it's own character; if you want modern and shiny (where you'll probably only sleep at night) go the the new JW Marriott or Ritz-Carlton a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “It's Budget! So why moan?”
Reviews.Author: Chrisallen2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights we wanted budget and thats what we got! For 52 bucks a night in LA who can complain?? The rooms in need of renovation, however a reasonable size.The hotel is on the edge of a dodgy area, buts stones throw away from the LA live, staples centre which was a good hang. Your about 10mins walk from the metro and the you have access to anywhere! It was clean you had free Internet access, in its day would have been a grand hotel! But not so much now. Cheap and cheerful!

Reviews.Title: “Run Forrest Run”
Reviews.Author: motrbob
Reviews.Content: The “Historic Mayfair Hotel Los Angeles” , located in the heart of downtown Los Angeles. Built in 1926, the hotel incorporates the finest modern amenities while still maintaining the original details and Old World elegance that reflect the grandeur of the era with glass etchings, brass fixtures, skylight and frenzied pillars. The charming historic Hotel is just blocks away from……….. The lobby is bright and clean and offers no insight to the hell you will soon endure. The first clue is when the hotel clerk photo copies your drivers license. Asked why the are doing this it is explained it is an accounting procedure. The second clue comes in the form of the announcement they are reserving additional funds on your credit card for any amenities that you may need or the need a 200.00 cash deposit. The third clue is one of the three elevators has an ashtray in the doorway and a sign closed for maintained. The “historic” part related to two different areas. First the room. The room has not been remodeled or thoroughly cleaned since the mid seventies. The carpets are filthy and squish when walked on, Grey dust is in all the carpet corners and the adjoining door way. There are “historic” Holes in the walls and the smoke detector on the ceiling had a black wing of dirt and dust around it. As to the amenities they wanted an additional deposit for there is a color television and nothing else. We wont even talk about the bathroom or the fact that I slept and walked in my socks. A shower was out of the question. The second “historic” part is the ability for this hotel to remain in business this long. I will say that the parking garage was as clean or cleaner than the room. I arrived late at night and had no choice other than stay the first night and the final blow came when I checked out early the next morning. I was informed that I would be charged for both nights as the reservation was made through an outside source, American Express, can you guess what I am contesting? One final point at least one of the websites have a tag line “Great Film and Television location”. This is because of the larceny and murders being conducted around the hotel. ‘Run Forrest Run”

Reviews.Title: “There are worse hotels and there are better hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Sophus016
Reviews.Content: If downtown or nearby is where you want to live in LA and price is of importance, then you can stay in a hotel built in 1926. If you seek a modern hotel, this isn't it. If you seek a hotel with a fancy restaurant, this isn't it. Free internet in the lobby is always ok. One of the best restaurants in town, The Pacific Dining Car, only 4 blocks away, (if alone take a taxi). Few or no interesting places nearby for shoppers so for men wanting their account to stay out of trouble, stay here. In other words it is basically a hotel where you get what you pay for. Probably still qualifies for 3 stars or thereabout.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, dodgy area, staff hit and miss, not for the feint of heart.”
Reviews.Author: Scottd237
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair was an interesting experience, but as I was part of a group I hadnt checked tripadvisor for reviews. I did once I was there though and much of what was said rang true. From the room service trays left in hallways for days, rooms with much broken, staff either disinterested in the in case of some abusive about clients when they didn't think people could hear them. It is a bargain for the price, but if you are new to LA I wouldnt recommend staying here as it will definitely put you off staying in LA very long. The parking facilities were spacious (although the parking attendant didnt seem to have any good days). The internet access was free, but very flakey. The hot water was a bit hit and miss and finding a working power in the room was very tricky. It was certainly a hotel where I wish there was a safe in the room! Oh and avoid eating there.. EVER.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain for the price, but the area is rough...really rough.”
Reviews.Author: rousieee
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we had to go and make sure we had the right place, it looked so posh and we hadn't paid much! The room was clean and really nice, we couldn't fault it. The problem with this hotel is the location, it's in a really bad part of town. We were on the top floor and saw lots of gangs hanging around on the streets below, even witnessed a drug deal. Unfortunately for us we have a van that's over 8 foot, the parking only allowed 7foot (costs $10). This wouldn't have been an issue but it was on a Sunday and none of the other parking places open until the next day. We ended up parking on a nearby street (off the road the hotel was on, no way were we leaving it there). I got up about 4 times to make sure no one had stolen it, and the next morning we found we had a parking ticket for parking the wrong way on the street - this must be a town thing. You'll be fine if you have a car, but be careful around this area at nightime.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: JustWonderful
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a dodgy part of town. Near downtown, but also near gangland! We missed our stop on the bus and ended up in a horrific place, beggars on the street, prostitutes etc, Not nice! Room is basic, two beds, telly and a tiny bathroom, it is okay but not the nicest. Found a cockroach on the last day, luckily it was as we were packing otherwise we would have been out of there. The shop downstairs is ran by a lovely lady though, she couldnt do enough to help me out when I wanted a few things- postcards, drinks etc- and her prices are reasonable. She was the only thing I would recommend about this hotel though. It is about 4 blocks from the subway and then it is a further 20-25 minutes to the Walk of Fame, and 30 minutes to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: isign
Reviews.Content: They don't tell you about the $100 fee plus a parking fee were added after I got tere. I was told the price of $89 per night on the phone whe I made this reservation for the night, ended up paying over $120 as I checked in. The employees are not the nicest people. It also took them over 5 hrs to come up to my room an service the TV and install the TDD phone (Phone used for Deaf people). The resturant in the hotel is NOT open they closed it, which their advertisments DO NOT tell you this. So in order to have some dinner I had to walk down to Figerora and 7th to find a resturant. (about 2 miles walk). I wil not recommend this to anyone! It is just not worth the trouble. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Was OK not the best”
Reviews.Author: dhowarth
Reviews.Content: the hotel seemed very dated and needed a bit of a update, i know the hotel is historic but just needs tidying. but over all the hotel was very nice. i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What positive is there at the Mayfair on 7th st?”
Reviews.Author: HotelTraveler39
Reviews.Content: Just plain disgusting. Disgusting service, rooms, and the area just should of been a clue. The general manager Sadler* I believe his name was? walks with his nose up in the air, even eyeballed my wife and I as if we were some criminals, I only make six figures, tip very well and have respect for everyone. Even my "Hello" to him didn't seem to ease the situation. but enough of just that one disrespectful staff member. Spent well over $500-700 just for a week but recieved my 150 deposit back so more around the 500 field due to false promises provided by the front desk. I was promised pro-rate if I decided to stay longer than the day or two originally planned but my company meetings ended up lasting longer. Two days of 80 dollars each day were not combined in the extended stay which was promised by a young female at Front Desk, so i had to spend 160 dollars for two days than pay their 150 dollar deposit and another 350 dollars for the weekly stay. People listen to these reviews, the staff cannot function a hotel promptly, I found a Jewish Manager and Baggage man to be the only helpful staff members but their schedules seem to have them only their for a very few hours of the days. You would think this was a classic hotel with great history, it's more of a hotel were you Addicts and Prostitutes find business. Pay the extra 10 or 20 dollars, you will have all the amentites which should be provided and you won't sleep with the fear of bed bugs. This is the first hotel I've had to put a thumbs down too, God Bless. Quick Notes: Internet is 'hi speed'? More like 56k speeds. Witmer Gang is near and fortunately avoided being robbed.

Reviews.Title: “adequate, good value online”
Reviews.Author: anemonefish
Reviews.Content: The Historic Mayfair was built in 1926 on the west side of downtown LA, and it's been updated in many respects, though some of the period elements (like the large lobby area) have been retained. Overall, our stay was fine. If booked through online discounters, it's good value. The neighborhood is a little rough, but typical of downtown fringes. Plenty of grocers and cafes, and only a couple of blocks easy walk from the high-rises, a half hour by foot from City Hall, etc. - 5 minutes by cab. Reception was efficient and friendly. The concierge helpful. Room was OK, though AC struggled on a hot LA day and a couple of drawer pulls were missing from the dresser. The "king" bed was double+twin mattresses pushed together with king-size linens. Firm but a good sleep. Limited amenities and plenty of towels. Housekeeping was fine with clean floors and tub. We recommend the top floors because the mid-sized windows both open a bit to let in fresh air and offer a superb view of downtown LA. Inside parking is an additional $10/day with easy in-and-out. The one disappointment was breakfast which came from a simple menu and was uninspired and lethargic, despite a nearly-empty restaurant. Ham from a processed loaf doesn't qualify as ham, just luncheon meat. Didn't get to try their lunches, and it's closed for dinner. There are also banquet and meeting facilities. The Historic Mayfair is good for a visit to downtown LA when having an inexpensive but decent place to sleep and clean up is the main requirement. It could also be a fine base for a tour of the wider LA area. It's also nice to support an enterprise that's holding onto some tradition in an era driven by a tear-down/build-up ethic.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe: gang shooting next to the hotel this morning”
Reviews.Author: Barbara300
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the Historic Mayfair when typing this review. I started this trip in NY and flew to LA where me and my boyfriend made a roadtrip. We stayed here for one night at the beginning of our road trip and arrived yesterday again for 3 nights...unfortunately.. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel is located in a very bad neighbourhood. This morning a gang shooting took place next to the hotel for example! We met some LAPD-men in Las Vegas who advised us not to walk around near the hotel after sunset and even the people from the front desk in the hotel told us to take a taxi if you wanna grab a bite to eat. They were right. We have travelled throughout the world and never felt unsafe until now. Rooms are ok sizewise but not very clean (dirty sheets, cockroaches in friends bathtub, shabby floor). The staff is friendly however. There are much better options for a good price near the Hollywood blvd or in Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “You get what pay for.”
Reviews.Author: sactraveller
Reviews.Content: To start the price was really cheap for a hotel near downtown LA. I wasnt sure what to expect with that price so i asked to see the room first. It was small but I was really tired to I stayed. It was a great decision. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to help me out. The area wasnt the best (low income community) but I had no problem. On the contrary, people would walk by me and say hi. I was really surprised of how friendly people can by. The negative things are that the restaurant is only open for breakfast. The rooms are small. But perhaps the thing that got me really mad was the general manager. I was having breakfast in the restaurant and for nothing he began screaming at the waiter, in front of me. I was shocked to see how furious the waiter and more shocked that the general manager didnt cared to look so unprofessional. That wasnt the only incident with the general manager. I was in the lobby and i saw how he got into an argument with one of the guest in the middle of the lobby. I was in the hotel for 5 day and i couldnt hlep but to noticed the how rude he is, especially to the employees. Hopefully they find someone else soon or they will have many legal problems. But besides that I really enjoyed my stay. PS. The view from my room was beautiful. I could see for miles.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but great value”
Reviews.Author: Londonshaz1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks. The hotel is in a less desirable area, but it's not that bad. In walking distance of the financial district and the Staples Centre. A highlight for us was that we had a great view of the Hollywood sign from our window. The gym wasn't anything to celebrate, but nice that they had one. I think a holiday is what you make it. We hired a car and went all over the place, and when we didn't have the car, we were able to explore on foot. When we went to the Staple Centre to watch Ice Hockey, we did feel a bit unsafe, so we ran there and ran back afterwards! Hotel staff were really friendly, and we LOVED the food - especially the Cobb salad and New York Steak Sandwich. We would definitely stay there again because we wanted a cheap hotel from which to explore LA.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump. . .”
Reviews.Author: ReverendDraco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Mayfair. . . and will never do so again. The only positive thing I can say is that it's close to the Good Samaritan Hospital, where my sister just had a triple bypass - the reason we were there. Where do I start? The staff was not, in the slightest, cordial or friendly - they seemed to not care even a little - very apathetic. Way overpriced for what you get - the rooms would have been an embarrassment to Motel 6. The headboards on the beds were attached, crookedly, to the wall. The TV wouldn't work until I re-arranged the plugs. The coffeemaker was broken - the little brew-stopper thing so you can pour a cup while it's still brewing - I had to fix that so I could make coffee. The dresser looked like something Goodwill refused to accept, the table in the room looked like it came out of somebody's break room, and the commode was one of those pre-motion detector truck stop toilets with no tank, just a valve. I didn't take a shower there, after my wife took one, and couldn't get the water temp adjusted - apparently, the cold water is almost hot enough to shower with, leaving the hot tap turned off. They also charged us a $150 deposit for "incidentals," but wouldn't explain what they meant. If we hadn't been so wiped out from being on the road all day, we would have went somewhere else. Stay Away.

Reviews.Title: “run”
Reviews.Author: SunshineCoastLee
Reviews.Content: good point first - location to subway about a km or less. cleaners seem to try hard. many bad points - room air conditioning not working - way too hot in rooms even though we are in winter. - staff front counter tell lies about why air cond is not working and say they will change you rooms but then they don't. - the fitness room is unsafe, the walking machine is dangerous, the stepper sounds like a plane taking off and the rowing machine is from the 70's. - the shower is unsafe for young children as it goes from hot to cold and back again. - last point a lovely brazilian man was lied to today by hotel staff saying a LA tour had audio in his native language, a total lie from staff once again. RUN AWAY AS FAST AS YOU CAN

Reviews.Title: “Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: jewelrybrilliant
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel for 2.5 months using ther extended stay plan (monthly plan and weekly plan). I don't reccomend this extended stay plan because #1 Had bugs proble (bed bugs, roaches)m, #2 Water quarity was very bad, with copper smell and other smell, never felt clean, #3 Room was cleaned up except air conditioner, air conditioner area was very very durty, didn't wanna even touch it. But the the staff were quite kind, some of them were very very kind...., also this hotel is very safe inside, not outside after 6 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Historical ain't, cleanliness OK”
Reviews.Author: Sobrina
Reviews.Content: A LONG five blocks from the closest Metro stop, area goes from OK to not so good pretty fast. Corner liquor store has a bulletproof glass cage for the cashier, but this bock did not feel particularly unsafe, just depressing. The staff is very polite and prompt to respond to requests. The room looked sad and weary but the bed was confy and the sheets clean. OK for a Priceline draw, but I wouldn't like to pay rack rate. BTW, if the building was indeed historical, it has been totally butchered by not too recent updates and none of the charm remains.

Reviews.Title: “cant complain about the service there i"snt any”
Reviews.Author: chrissymWhyalla
Reviews.Content: Downtown LA dont go there if you want to feel safe walking around at night.We found we had to do all of our trips and be back early because all the seedy charactors come out after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Nice building”
Reviews.Author: Gnomemother
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very grand and very beautiful, however it's location was less than appealing. I felt unsafe once outside of the hotel and whether that was just my impression or actually was the case, didn't change the fact that I didn't feel able to go out after dark. The staff were welcoming on arrival, but when I had a problem logging onto the internet, I felt that I was a bit of a nusience. They had in fact given me the wrong log in details, twice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel Needs Help”
Reviews.Author: flutterbytravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is suffering from neglect and poor management. I have worked in the hotel industry for many years and have never seen a so called 3 star hotel look in this bad a shape.It is in a not so great neighborhood in downtown LA. Our first room was on the tenth floor and as soon as we got off the elevator we looked up to see chewing gum stuck to the ceiling, we lost count after 10 wads, stains on the walls and our room was the size of a cabin on a cruise ship. The bathroom was sooo small we had to step into the tub to shut the door. The furniture and ac looked like it had been there since the 60's. We called the front desk to get a different room and we were told that there was nothing he could do. We called Hotels.com, that's who booked our reservation and they said that it was up to the hotel as to whether we could get a decent room. So the next morning we spoke with Juliaanna the front desk mgr. and she gave us a new room that was larger. The problem was that the ac was broken and we were told to go out for a few hours and they would have the ac fixed. We came back 6 hrs later to find a room that was hotter than it was outside by about 15 degrees at about 80 degrees. We called the front desk and they told us it would get fixed in the morning. Then the engineering guy said that he couldn't figure out why they gave us this room because the ac had been broken for months. We then called Hotels.com and told them about the problems and that we wanted to cancel the rest of our stay and get a refund so that we could go to a better hotel. Hotels.com said that if the Mayfair didn't want to refund us the money for next three nights that there was nothing that they could do. Hotels.com did nothing to help us at all. The Mayfair would not refund us for the next three nights. So we were stuck in a hot room. The next day we get a knock on the door from engineering to let us know that the ac couldn't be fixed until the following Monday because of the 4th of July and that the parts place was closed. So they moved us to our third room in three nights and that's where we stayed at least the ac worked. So let's recap, rooms in bad shape, the front desk staff is curt except for the graveyard shift. No shuttle service, the restaurant that is run by someone other than the hotel was closed most of the time. We do not recommend this hotel nor Hotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Sub par”
Reviews.Author: One2Few
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is that it was clean. This hotel was old, and not old in a good way. You can tell that there hasn't been any major renovations since it's opened. There were holes in the walls and carpet, leak marks on the ceiling and chips in the furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Room is tolerable if you aren't picky, but don't eat here.”
Reviews.Author: jenniferjordan1
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?? The front desk is barely courteous and not at all helpful. Found it disturbing that upon check-in you are given a sheet with a disclaimer stating the hotel is not responsible for any items you keep in your room during your stay! The rooms are tiny and the double bed is two twins shoved together. There are no amenities unless you count the sometimes operating wifi. There are two computers for general use downstairs, but the keyboards are so filthy I wouldn't touch them. It's a $.50 charge for each printed page. There is a restaurant on the second floor, which is horrible - both food and service. I had moldy toast served with my very overpriced breakfast and you could paste the wall with the alfredo sauce on the pasta I had the evening before. Went to charge to my room - couldn't because they aren't owned by the hotel. If by "historic" hotel they mean "old", then they at least have that correct. Everything is outdated including the 80s music they have piped in the lobby. There is no bar, but the restaurant advertises "Beer and Wine - $5.00" if you dare. Horrible stay. Will NOT be doing this hotel again. Unfortunately it was recommended by the company I registered with for a conference, who was unaware of how bad the hotel was, as they were from Michigan. It was too late to book us into something else.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty awful experience, strictly stay if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: calibear314
Reviews.Content: Pros - Near Staples Center - Cheap rates - Staff is friendly, mainly to make up awful facility Cons - Rooms were small and filthy - Bathroom small and shower was too small to use - Unsafe location, really UNSAFE The Mayfair Hotel really meant it when they said Old World hotel. First off, the hotel is near the LA Staples Convention Center, so that's the one plus. Also, it was pretty much the cheapest hotel I was able to find at around $70 per night so I didn't expect much. But would never stay here again or even recommend this place. The location is NOT safe. You walk one block in the wrong direction and you're really looking for trouble. For the rooms, they were small, NO DESK (I had a corner room), small full bed and an old-school TV with I believe 9 channels. The room was filthy with torn wallpaper. My biggest gripe with the room were numerous holes and pits around the room. While I didn't see any insects, I didn't try looking for fear of having being right about my instincts. Bed sheets were thin and worn. The worst feature for my stay was the awful bathroom. The shower was too small and had an awkward "step" in the middle of the tub which made it impossible for me to face the shower head. The shower tub was not wide enough for me to face the shower so I had to shower sideways the entire time. Also, the shower head was too low to comfortably wash oneself. The entire bathroom itself was too tiny and just plain awful. I didn't bother using any other facilities in the hotel but the fitness facility was pitiful when I viewed it. Service was adequate and it was a shame since they had to work for such a poorly run down hotel. Don't expect much from the hotel and I definately spent as little time in the hotel as possible. If it means anything, the hotel did have wireless access. Thankfully, I won't be staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair fair deal”
Reviews.Author: konaboy_9
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the USA, for a big city downtown hotel it is a very good deal. If you are anal spend a extra $125 and stay in one of the name brand boxes! Clean rooms nice staff, international travelers and a working class neighbor hood make it a nice place to stay. There are several “hole in the wall” food places and a great Mexican meat market within a block. At the market they froze up and boxed 20 lbs. of chorizo for me to take back to Hawaii. There is a Mexican take out about 5 minuet walk which serves the best Thai I have had in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and good price”
Reviews.Author: pagesb
Reviews.Content: I've been staying there for two nights with two friends. We took a double bed room for approximately 80 US$ per night, it's really cheap and well located in Downtown with metro line 3 blocks away and buses lines just in front. Really convenient to explore Los Angeles different districts. It was really clean and staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “terrible terrible terrible”
Reviews.Author: bbbaaa5757
Reviews.Content: stay away the rooms are filthy the rooms have a odor walls are dirty carpet are dirty problably the worst hotel ive stayed out good luck in the elevators very slow creepy this place reminded me of a hotel a convict would hole out in not worth any price you get

Reviews.Title: “Be careful what you ask for”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFleur
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few nights because I had to find an inexpensive stay in LA where I could use my AMEX points. I am very well traveled and have stayed in many grades of hotels around the world. Orbitz has this hotel rated as 3 star. Turns out that this is certainly not the case. Its more of 2 - 2.5, which is where the rating on TripAdvisor is falling. Check out the review by 30Gauge posted July 27th 2008 who gives a good assessment of the facilities. I am not as enthusiastic as she however due to: 1. The Sat night that I arrived from the east after midnight local time they had turned the mezzannine bar and restaurant into a dance club. Even on the 8th floor I had some trouble falling asleep due to this. On other nights the trash pickup, car alarms and such, from the street were frequent and loud enough to wake me up. 2. The TV did not work with the remote. 3. Do not take the cheaper rooms with shower only. I can handle shower only but this was more like a janitors tub converted to a shower. I have no better analogy for it. The swings between cold and hot water were severe. 4. The service and restaurant were a bit suspicious so I did not bother to test them. Called at 2am for a wake up call but no one ever picked up. 5. Bed was firm - nice. 6. Parking garage seems safe and is cheap. In the end, if you want an inexpensive place to stay and can lower your expectations of service then this is a place to consider, but don't believe that its 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a Bore”
Reviews.Author: Ive_Got_Reservations
Reviews.Content: Had the average room problems, IE a musty rooms with two light bulbs out. The buildings exterior is gorgeous, but inside its drab and the people who work there match. The location is pleasant, I didn't have to do much freeway driving, and the price is definitely right. Overall I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down Hotel in a Run Down Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: The condition of this hotel is beyond repair or renovation. It should be demolished. It's hard to know where to even begin. The room was nothing short of disgusting. Worn out carpet, curtains, beds, furniture, bath fixtures - everything. Just nasty. The neighborhood is no better - boarded up and barred windows. I was at a conference that booked attendees at this hotel, and I heard many people commenting in disbelief that this hotel was approved for the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Review From a Resident”
Reviews.Author: constabletbear
Reviews.Content: I have lived as a resident at the Mayfair Hotel on and off for a while so will give you the good and bad. Bad - you are very lucky if reception answers the phone at all when ringing from your room .I've gone downstairs after ringing for over an hour to find an empty lobby and the 3 people doing nothing behind the desk said they were too busy. This is a regular occurence. If you can't be bothered going down then ring from your cell. - most staff have a don't care attitude. If you need anything ask for Bing, she is the only one who seems to care. Maintenence are also pretty quick to respond, their no. is on the phone. The owners and management are very hard to pin down so don't bother - instead of evacuating guests during the recent earthquake, all staff downstairs ran for the door. The building also shook, creaked and swayed like a drunken 90 year old. - if there is a quake above 6 this building will most likely come down, check out the huge cracks in the building - smoking rooms have no ashtrays and have burns on the edges of the furniture - some rooms and bathrooms are very tiny and outdated - a lot of the TV remotes don't work, ring maintenence - some rooms have no ironing or coffee facilities, keep ringing maintenence if this happens - some beds are rock hard and will cause neck/back problems if you sleep on your side - thin, old curtains let in lots of light - walls are very thin - lots of noise on 7th St side from traffic and the Church across the road - the 3 elevators are very old and break down all the time. Sometimes there are only 1 or 2 working and you can wait up to 6-7 minutes to get in. The cleaners also block the doors to keep them on the floor they are working which doesn't help. Good - cheap, from $870 for a monthly rate on a smaller room - 5 min walk to Downtown - most rooms have a full-size refrigerator and microwave which can save a bit of money on eating out. - some rooms and bathrooms are quite spacious. For a small room with a huuuuge bathroom, ask for a corner room on the SW side. for a bigger room with medium bathroom ask for a corner room on the North East corner - rooms are quite clean, haven't had any problems with bed bugs which is highly unusual for any hotel. Carpets are steam cleaned pretty often. - cleaners don't steal your money or possesions when you leave them lying around, although I wouldn't recommend this - restaurant is fairly good value but don't bother with room service - closets are fairly spacious, even for a resident - everyone says it's a dodgy area which 2 years ago it probably was. I'm very small and walk around the area nearly every night and have never once felt threatened. I've found the people around the area to be very hospitable and polite. - unlike the Downtown hotels there are no beggars or homeless people residing near the entrance. - the bar downstairs is very cheap. - internet service is excellent most of the time, very quick and very cheap ($20 per month). Not sure of the nightly rate I reside here so it cant be too bad. The very cheap monthly rates outweigh the bad points for me. Life is what you make it!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Convention Experience!”
Reviews.Author: 30Gauge
Reviews.Content: My wonderful stay at the Mayfair started when I began the booking process. Despite that I had a number of questions and called to change my reservation several times (including in the middle of the night), the employee who assisted me was always helpful, informative, and cheery. I had chosen this hotel in particular because of the other reviews (that the hotel was old but clean and small but affordable) and was actually looking forward to writing mine even while staying in the room--it was everything I hoped that it would be. When we arrived we were able to park quickly in their garage, which was easy to find and accessible. The parking is $10 a day, which you can include in your room's bill, and there is an attendant on duty 24 hours which made me feel much safer about my van. We had a slight issue due to the cartop carrier making my van higher than the height limit, but the hotel rectified this quickly, allowing us to park in a reserved spot just inside the door where we could fit (I later learned this was the hotel manager's spot, and if he ever reads this I'd like to thank him for allowing us to do this.) The lobby was white and clean with marble floors, comfortable chairs, and a grand piano. They have a large collection of art decorating many of the walls, and three extremely fast elevators that saved me several times when I'd been running late. Check-in went smoothly, and we got into our room. I will agree that these rooms are SMALL. We had rented a room with two double beds, and with four of us in there we were very cramped. Everything was very clean, comfortable, and elegant, however, and the staff responded very quickly to our requests, so it was actually a good value for the money. The shower had a...strange issue. It tended to alternate between warm and cool water, but it allowed enough time between changes for me to get the job done so I wasn't terribly concerned. On the third night we decided to move into a Junior Suite so that we'd have a bit more room, and this made a world of difference. If you have the budget, I'd strongly suggest booking one of the Mayfair's suites, because for the same price that you'd pay for a regular room at most of the other downtown hotels you get double the space, two bathrooms, two closets, an extra TV, a microwave, refrigerator, and a couch that pulls out into a bed. Each pair of us was able to take our own half of the suite and close the door between the two halves for a welcome bit of privacy and extra bed-space. For only an extra $35 per night we essentially got an entire extra room. Beyond the cleanliness and value, I had MANY exceptional encounters with the staff, who very quickly were able to take care of needs ranging from moving us to our new room, finding us an all-night Thai restaurant that delivered, and locating a screwdriver that I borrowed for a last minute fix to one of our convention business displays. I do agree that the neighborhood is rough. However, it is not scary so much as it is just OLD and somewhat dirty, which is a strange contrast to how it looks just a few blocks down across the highway. I did go out at night, however, several times, and did not have any real issues. If you are staying at the Mayfair for a convention, I would recommend against walking (it is somewhat far.) We took our van daily to the convention center and parked it there for $12, which was cheaper than a taxi two-ways and more than worth the cost to not have the inconvenience of that distance on our feet. I found it a great place to stay for the convention, however, because the distance kept away the majority of the crowds and allowed me to relax easier at night without worrying about noise or parking. Because of the Mayfair hotel, I'm already looking forward to next years trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: lobstahgal
Reviews.Content: Our family attended the Rotary convention. Our original hotel couldn't accomodate our travel changes, so we were switched to this hotel. It was affectionately referred to by us and many other guests as "The Pre -Historic Mayfair". The bathroom was so small you had to straddle the toilet to close the door. The vanity counter was miniscule...enough room for a toothbrush and a glass. The shower changed temperature constantly. There were no room service menus in the room. When I inquired at the front desk, the clerk had no idea what I was talking to. Another clerk referred me to the restaurant upstairs. When I asked the manager for a room service menu, I had to wait, as all the available menus were out to tables. When we finally attempted to order from the room, we were hung up on. We called the front desk who assured us that room service would call us right back. We ended up ordering Thai from a local restaurant that delivered. In the elevator lobby on our floor, a room service tray sat for over 2 days on the table. No one from housekeeping cleaned it up. Some days we would get one face cloth for 4 people...other days...not! On the plus side...we were in one of the rooms that had the beds upgraded with new mattresses, so at least they were comfy. The staff was pleasant, except for the one room service dude who kept hanging up on us. However, not one of the best places to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved esp. hotel-restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SkipGifhorn
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was OK, but what impressed me most was the kind reception in the hotel restaurant. Very friendly staff, going out of their way to please. Breakfast executive style 10 dollar good value for the money The concierge very helpful to organize shuttle service to int.airport. Taxi would cost 50 dollars, shuttle at 15 dollars pp. I can recommend PRIME TIME SHUTTLE , red vans. (733 8267) In L.A. I found a visit to Hollywood and there a round trip Open deck bus most enjoyable, starts at Chinese Theatre ( hop on - hop off)

Reviews.Title: “Poor , strange Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marhaus
Reviews.Content: The neighbourhood wasn't as bad as I expected , but I don't advise lonely women to stay there. In my two night stay I saw the police getting inside the building twice while coming in or out. It 's really worth if you have to go downtown or to the Staples Center and you are in a group, but for a few dollars more you can get a much better hotel. Think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: CountrymusicfanUK
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in order to attend a Garth Brooks conceert at the Staples Centre and chose it because of its location i.e. 10 minutes walk from the venue. Having read some of the reviews of this hotel I was worried as to what we would find. We were pleasantly surprised to find a pleasant , clean and relatively spacious room on the 12th floor with views of the Staples Centre on one side and the Hollywood sign on the other. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and we felt safe in the location. We walked to and from the Staples Centre with no problems and walked through the area to use the Metro when we needed. Granted we were never out late at night but that would apply in many cities. Taxis were readily available had we wanted them and when we booked a full day tour the company collected us from the hotel and delivered us back there. For us this hotel was in a good location but it is probably not good for the main attractions in Los Angeles because of the distance from them if you do not have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: anupshar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in downown LA, a good location with a very poor room service that made the stay very unpleasant. The room is very small, bathroom is so small that you can't even move. The heating system was dead. The TV was not working, had to ask for repair when we arrived. Room Service was pathetic. I asked for 2 tea-bags and gave 3 calls to the service desk. They never came. They said no more than 2 tea bags per day are given, although I stayed for a week and had paid $495 for my stay. Very discourtious service. No restaurant, no bar, internet is very poor and erratic. I did not enjoy my stay at the Mayfair hotel. I would not book this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: haiweepp
Reviews.Content: The first problem that we came across was the lack of adequate staff at check-in. Two employees were behind the desk but one was eating from a to-go box and the other was quite slow in accomplishing even simple tasks. Once registered, though, it was downhill. We had booked two rooms, one with two single beds and one described as a "Queen" bed. When we went to the first of the rooms and used our card to open the door we scared the hell out of a small Chinese woman who had already occupied the room. We backed out apologizing but, when we went back to the desk to get a new room and complain, we were pretty much just ignored save to give us a new card for a new room. and then their attention went to the next "guest" in line No one said anything about the abysmal level of professionalism that this mistake made plain. The so-called "Queen" bed was in an extremely small room and was no wider than a standard double bed and still only left about one foot between the bed and the walls. The shower and tub (which they advertised as a "bathtub") was 32 inches wide and 36 inches long (give or take 2 inches). That was, even as a stretch of the imagination, not a tub. We ate at the hotel's restaurant and found that the food quality was less than average and the service left us sitting for 5-10 minutes waiting for a simple coffee refill. The waffles had no real taste and the eggs were overcooked and cold. All in all I would strongly recommend against staying at this hotel. Between the staff's incompetence and the hotel's definition of a Queen bed and a "deluxe" room you would be much better served to save the overpriced rates and just stay at a Comfort Inn or a Motel 6. At least there you expect these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: lapix
Reviews.Content: Definitiveliy not the best hotel , BUT IS NOT THAT BAD. Ispent the night there last week, and it was good. Of course you have to be careful if you go out at night. And it has a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “what adump”
Reviews.Author: SANZA
Reviews.Content: well i booked this room for the e for all convention in los angeles in october the lobby was really nice but the elevator was squeaking all the time i used it. The room was warm when i got there and the air conditioner was not working until 2 days before i left. The bathroom was the most horrific thing in this place i mean a tub that was about 5 feet in length and had 3 steps in it i mean im 6 ft 2 and i felt crampt in it and to get in and out you almost had to jump over the toilet to get in the tub. Every night when i return to the hotel i had to get my card swiped to get into my room which got to be a hassle and the staff got more and more rude as the week stay progressed. Not to mention the dodgy area that the hotel was in was not making it easier in the least. To some credit for the hotel the bed was nice to sleep in but everything else that happened made it a dump. if people want to stay here for 1-2 nights this is not a bad hotel but for a long stay check out other places to stay as this is not for a long trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: AngelaABC
Reviews.Content: Not in the best neighborhood and definitely showing its age, still the Mayfair is a perfectly fine place to stay. I wouldn't recommend it for a vacation, but if you're in town for a night or two and just need a place to sleep, it's a fine and affordable choice. The rooms are very small but clean, and the staff very friendly. The restaurant was being remodeled when we were there, but they recommend delivery from LaBella Cucina and had a wonderful (if cramped) in-room meal.

Reviews.Title: “worse than a motel”
Reviews.Author: BBJCa
Reviews.Content: My family stayed there for 4 nights in May. I booked this Mayfair hotel only because Hotwire claimed it is 2.5 star, compares to Holiday Inn Express. The lobby and the restaurant is nice. However, you can not sleep in the lobby. The room is worse than a motel. Think about it: The hotel is 80 years old. 1. the old air conditioner did not work. 2. there are holes in carpet, they should be replaced long time ago. 3. there are holes in the blanket 4. the light bulb in bathroom did not work 5. the bathroom is the smallest I ever seen 6. the curtains can not move 7. there are yellow stains in the room's ceiling 8. The hot water turns into cool while I was taking the shower. The only thing I like there is the free wireless Internet access. The staff were polite but I would rather stay in a motel. Believe me, do not stay there. BTW, parking is $10 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: spackyjac
Reviews.Content: Well my boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel due to my stupid travel agent who booked us in there. This was our first trip to the States and what a horrible introduction! First of all, I couldn't help but notice that there seemed to be a ghetto outside our hotel. I found that terrifying because I am just not used to that sort of thing in my country. Secondly the rude staff checked us in to a skanky twin single bed room when we asked for a king room. The rooms were terrible! I've never seen anything like it! The tv was old and we could not get any channels, the bedspread was dirty, the walls were peeling. The only upside to this hotel was the attractive lobby and the helpful concierge staff. Otherwise this was absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. DON'T STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Hotel..Rude Staff..Room the size of a closet”
Reviews.Author: KWTravels
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from my closet size room that I paid $100 for. I am staying here while I go t a conference nearby. Checking was no treat. No front desk cleark was rude. When I got to my room, it wasa joke. I honestly have seen bigger closets in houss. The room is less than 10 x 10. The bathroom is about 2 x 4, with a "shower/tub" the size of thimble. It is actually 1 x 2. The furniture was as old as the hotel it looked like. I stayed in room 1202. The walls were filthy, I was afraid to walk on the carpet barefoot, it was so filthy. Dinner was a joke. Myself and to people I came here with went to the hotel restaurant, because you really dont want to wlk on the streets here. It is pretty scary outside...ghetto hood......Dinner- Waiter told us to "just sit anywhere".. There was only 2 other tables with people at them while we were there. Service was horrible. He just dropped the menus on the table and said.."I'll be back"....This is ok if you are at a low price place I guess... But the Menu was not cheap... Pretty high priced meals I ordered the steak sandwich @ $16.00, The other 2 got the garden burger. It took over 45 mins for the food tocome out... Like I said....only 2 other tables were there...not like they were busy. Never got a refill on my ice tea. Nor did he waiter ever stop by to ask about our meal. When we wre done, he stopped by and asked," So, you gonna pay cash... or what?".... That sent me over the edge...I told him I would be talking to the front desk to pay my bill... Went downstairs and the GM happened to be there... I told him what had happened and said, just take care of my dinner bill.....and stop by my room later so I can show you some concerns.... He never came by and I will see if my bill has a dinner charge when I check out... I will follow up with another review.... Reviews.Title: “Worn down hotel”
Reviews.Author: wolveriner
Reviews.Content: I book most of my hotels thru Hotwire and was quite disappointed this time as this was a 3 star hotel. I have stayed at 2 star facilities, that were better than this. The room had two single beds versus the common two double beds. The carpet was worn out and the bathroom light was very dim. It is a very basic hotel wth thin blankets and non-functional heat. There were no sanitary problems and the neighbourhood is not was as threatening as other suggested.

Reviews.Title: “For the Adventurer and Budget Conscious”
Reviews.Author: jmb1969
Reviews.Content: We booked the Mayfair through the convention we were attending at the LA Convention Center. For those expecting what they see on TV from such shows as The Apprentice or Beverly Hills 90210, you will be sorely disappointed. To the defense of the hotel, it was situated 3 blocks from the main financial district in an area undergoing obvious signs of re-vitailization with a luxury condo just a block away. The staff were always sincere, friendly and accomodating...no minor feat as there were many guest who were not as understanding as us. The hotel has definitely seen better days, but the room was cleaned daily and fresh towels available. There were no signs of roaches or bedbugs! Our first day saw the elevators not working (we were on the 15th floor) and the lack of water or low water pressure due to a storm the night before. All the issues were resolved by the next day, although we needed to use the restrooms in the lobby before retiring. We were fortunate to have a nice view of the "Hollywood" sign out our window. Perhaps on the first two days my friends and I felt "unsafe" with all the "vibrant" characters that roamed the street outside the hotel..but this is the case with much of downtown LA in the evening; but in the end we got a sense of the "pulse" of the area and felt a bit more comfortable at the end of the trip. For the extra $50/day or so, you could stay at the Wilshire Grand located 3 blocks away right in the financial district...much nicer hotel with 3 restaurants and a bar...but after dark, downtown LA is pretty much the same anywhere your hotel is located...make sure you have lots of cab fare or consider renting a car. All in all, we got a chance to see the reality of a city with the population and economical diversity of LA...not a bad thing...I'd like to see how things change over the next 5 years in this area...I'm sure I'll be pleasantly surprised! If you come with no pre-concieved ideas and want to stay in the downtown area, then the Mayfair provides the basics for the budget conscious.
