Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!! Horrible hotel for families!”
Reviews.Author: j151984
Reviews.Content: My family, mother, sisters, and my girlfriend stayed here with me at this hotel. We were on vacation to universal studios. We should have known something was fishy about 70 bucks when everyone else was either sold out or in the 200-400's. We had two rooms. One single queen and another with 2 double beds. This place is surrounded by a low class neighboorhood. If you have seen the movie, "falling down," the park that kurt douglas walks around in, yeah just down the street. It felt that way also. We arrived at the front gate to an unwelcoming guy. He was rude and told us to park on a level that had no parking. We check in, and everything seemed fine. My girlfriend and i were in a queen non smoking. We walked into our room. It was very small. Almost, if any bigger, than a janitors room. The bed was right next to the door, the tv was right in frotn of the bed with arms reach, and the bath room was next to the door. Ok we dealt with that. We check the bath room. I was able to stretch my arms from one side of the wall to the other, that included their sink, their toilet, and their bath/shower. We layed ready for bed, so just hear the springs popping under the matress. Then you could hear people coughing, sitting on their beds, talking, and you could hear everything through their walls. Plus this place is located in a neighborhood so you heard all the wild parties...atleast someone was enjoying their night. The morning we decided to take showers. I went in, couldn't fit. I'm 6'0 and my whole top of my chest was standing out. There was no way for anyone to stand inside their shower because it was like a minature slide pool they made. So we had to take our shower stepping in and out. Then we had no remote. This huge hotel and no remote. then plus got the whole we are sold out, eventhough parking was not close to full. We did report it to the personal to be told you have to talk with them in the morning, the morning then said i had to write to their manager. Then on the way out, we ran into a cute couple of 3, females wearing see thru underwear and a see thru shirt into their parking lot, through their hotel, and back to somewhere where some very interested hotel workers followed to the unknown area of the parking lot. This was the worst ever hotel experience i have had. I will not every recommend going their, even free! Stay away...

Reviews.Title: “It's not too bad at all”
Reviews.Author: millefleur
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay a night after concert in Los Angeles so I chose this hotel after looking into so many different hotels and their reviews. It was pretty good and I was satisfied. The staffs were very polite and nice. The room was smaller than how it looks on their site but it wasn't dirty or smelly at all. What I wish was they have a better shower. It was hard to control the temperature of the water and water pressure was low. The bathtub was well... not a tub I would take a bath in. If it's for a single night, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone, but worked well for us”
Reviews.Author: LibraryShark
Reviews.Content: We booked the Mayfair through Hotwire the day before we checked in. The front desk manager was very polite and helpful. The parking garage attendant was also polite and helpful. There is a $7.75/day fee to park, but it was definitely worth it, and we always found a spot, no matter what time of day. (We came and went a lot.) The neighborhood is on the edge of downtown, but the convenient DASH bus will pick you up directly across the street from the hotel lobby if you are going to other downtown locations. (And it only costs a quarter to ride.) Anyway, the blocks that are adjacent to the hotel aren't terrific. I don't think I'd feel safe walking alone after dark, for instance. But during the day there is so much traffic and hustle-and-bustle that it wasn't a problem. If you park in the garage, you don't ever have to walk on the street. There is an entrance from the garage to the hotel. Our room was on a non-smoking floor, thank goodness, and had a nice view of the city. We could see the Hollywood sign in the distance. The building is old, but shabby bathrooms and carpet don't really bug me. It was clean and comfortable. There was a coffee pot and ironing board in the room, plenty of fresh towels, decent pillows, comfortable mattress, etc. The television was fine. My only complaints are of a stale odor in the room (probably from the old carpet) and the shower head was for short people. I am 5' 8" and had to stoop. Oh, one other complaint, actually: we tried to call the front desk and the hotel operator to ask a question, and no one ever answered the phone even after 20+ rings. That was kind of disconcerting. But the staff in the lobby was helpful. There is a concierge as well as front desk attendants. Bottom line: this place is dirt cheap, so if you aren't picky about luxury accomodations and want a central location in L.A., the Mayfair is a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Better than what it looks like from reviews”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2855
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and then read the reviews written about the hotel. I was gonna cancel the reservation, but i decided to try the hotel. To be honest, it is not that bad as it is described in the reviews. I should mention that you are booking a pretty cheap hotel. therefore, you should not expect great facilities. however, from my idea, this hotel was good to stay, and I recommend others to stay in this hotel IF you have a car or at least some one will give you ride to the hotel. The hotel is located one block from financial district of LA, which makes it almost unsafe during the night. it is located in pretty poor area of mexican people. the staff were really helpful, the breakfast is not included but there is good lunch buffet every day. the sheets in my room was clean and new. the washroom is pretty small and the watter presure is not very strong. there is exactly bus station accross the street, which goes to the downtown and there is two big Macy's mal in the walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Poor”
Reviews.Author: Zendoggie
Reviews.Content: I reserved at the Mayfair because it was the closest hotel with availability to the E3 Conference. Staff was friendly and helpful, but overall the hotel is pretty shabby. Rooms are dingy. Television in the bedroom did not work. One bedside lamp had a burned out bulb, the other a broken switch – so I spent a few minutes assembling a working lamp from the two. Internet connectivity was very slow and unreliable, bad for business travelers. The Mayfair is servicable as a crash-pad, but not for anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Short Sheet the Bed”
Reviews.Author: Martinus
Reviews.Content: Looked OK at the travel agent who booked early check in due to our arrival at LAX 7.00 am. Got there at 9.30, staff knew nothing about it and made us wait until 1.00 pm for room to be ready. Staff not helpfull at all. Hotel is located just off the downtown precint which is not their fault and OK if you are careful. What is their fault are filthly carpets especially in the dining room and botttom sheets so small they pop out every time you turn over. Stay there again No Way Jose'

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All in all this was a great hotel. I've seen some of the reviews and was a little reluctant to stay here because they seemed so negative. Let me tell you, the rooms are small, but the carpet and walls were clean. The towels and bed spread was clean.The staff was very friendly and helpful. The outside area was not scary.I think some of the people that posted negative messages are either from another world or rich and snobby and usually stay in 10 star hotels but had to stay here because everything was booked.(ha ha) Me and my wife didnt have any problems. We walked up and down the streets with no problems. We've seen worse in downtown ATL. I highly recommend this hotel for the price. We were only 15 mins from hollywood and all the main attractions. Oh Yeah One more thing: LA traffic is terrribbbbbleeeeee!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good safety, friendly staff, no problems. Just be careful walking around downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there. Bad bad bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Los Angeles a week ago, checked in the hotel for 4 days, and the experience of our stay wasn't quite what we were expecting. The room was small, there were visible stains at several spots on the carpet (which, was suppose to be burgundy but somehow looked really brownish - not in a good way) and produces unpleasant odor. The room ceiling had white dust falling down every now and then, when asked, we were told that it was due to the moisture created, especially after showering. We had our room changed, but the condition did not improve much at all. The new room had a bathroom that one can hardly get through, and I'm 150 lbs! Hot water wasnt Their lunch buffet was decent, but their servers clearly showed their lack of training.

Reviews.Title: “old structure, problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I personally would not recommend this place to anyone. The hotel is a very old structure, so do prepare to run into some problems when you check in to the place such as smelly carpet or a/c that does not quite do its job. Also, I called the housekeeping number to request for towels, but they simply picked up and hung up the phone ( twice) !!!! What a stay...

Reviews.Title: “Fine as long as you don't care about going outside”
Reviews.Author: bilz
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair is a very old hotel slightly out of the downtown area. The good part of that is that you don't have to deal with any of the vagrant downtown crowd panhandling while waiting for buses. The bad part is that you aren't near anything and it is unwise to walk anywhere at any time of day. There are some run down apartments on both sides of the hotel and several hotels across the street charge hourly rates. These were all strategically omitted from any of the pictures you will see of the hotel. The lobby of the hotel is very fancy looking and has 24 hour security which does a good job of keeping non-hotel guests out. The hotel also has an attached parking garage with 24 hour security at a reasonable daily rate for downtown ($5). The rooms are nothing more than utilitarian, and the complaint about the old musty air conditioners is valid. Mine broke and leaked water everywhere and I was forced to change rooms during the middle of my stay. In a city where a Super 8 can run you $90/night, the room is not a terrible value, especially in comparison to the typical chain hotels in the area (Holiday Inn, Hilton Checkers, etc). I'm not overly impressed with the hotel but I wouldn't tell anyone not to stay here either. After all, it's Los Angeles, low expectations are a must.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as others describe it...”
Reviews.Author: Huskies04
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is very nice. It made me think that the hotel might be really nice overall. But once we out of the elevator and to our room, my attitude changed. The hallways were very, very old looking. Lots of stuff in the hotel needs some work. The room we had wasn't that small, but it certainly wasn't great. The bathroom was horrible. Could not get a good temperature of water in the shower for anything. Everything was just really old looking. But, I have seen worse. Now as far as the outside of the building goes, my friend and I were shocked at how safe the streets were because we had read the reviews on this site prior to going. We were in LA for the Pac 10 tourney and we did get a rental car so that we could drive around and do some site seeing in our free time. We ended up walking to Staples Center and back to the hotel on the third and last day of games because we saw nothing threatening about it. And in the walk to the arena and back we were not put in any kind of danger. The streets outside and around the mayfair hotel are unlike any other city streets I've ever been to. Nothing to worry about as long as you be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry but clueless to others' complaints”
Reviews.Author: Volitans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just had 4 nights at this hotel and loved it. Sure it's not the Taj Mahal but we didn't pay for that. And maybe we were lucky in the streets but we walked everywhere at all hours and apart from the odd homeless guy we felt safe and had no troubles. The main reason we walked was that no one told us that the US runs on small change. The buses and trains required EXACT change but no shops would give you any unless you bought something. One bus driver had us begging other passengers for change. When we finally got the hang of holding our coins for public transport there was a 'dash' bus right at the front door that joined buses for any part of LA at a quarter (25c) a ride. Our room was much larger than we expected (and as it turned out larger than all but 1 other room we had on our world trip) but it wasn't huge either. The coffee/tea percolator in our room was great but I baulk at powdered coffee whitener. The bathroom was fine and the decor rustic. We also now know that american cars have 3 horns - no car could make that much noise with just one and we could hear them of a night but nowhere near as bad as NYC. We bought a fold up umbrella in their gift shop that we found out later when we opened it was broken. On return to the shop the lady was devastated and couldn't replace it quick enough. Bottom line - I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Bang for your buck!!”
Reviews.Author: yayitsme
Reviews.Content: I decided to give this hotel 5 stars, because in fact it was EXCELLENT for the price that we paid. The price range alone should indicate to anyone expecting to stay here, that it's not the Ritz. However, it was exactly what I needed for a weekend stay in LA. As far as the location is concerned, the hotel is situated minutes from two of the best bars in town, the Gopher Bar and the bar at the downtown Standard Hotel. During the day, there were tons of places to go shopping, with Nordstorm's and Macy's just down the street. Many well known restaurant's were also within a short drive from the hotel. As for all the comments regarding how terrible it is at night, there are definitely worse places to be than here. Just use common sense and don't walk by yourself aimlessly during odd hours of the night. I do have to give credit to the staff at the Mayfair, as they were friendly and nice, and always had our best interests in mind. They even gave us a room with an awesome view of the Hollywood sign. The rooms were a little small, but then again we used them for just sleeping so size was of no concern. All in all, for the price I paid, this hotel was quite the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for theprice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at this facility, location not the greatest but who walks the streets at night in any town? Great first impression when you enter the lobby, great service and nice resturant, Have paid much more for accomodations in other major cities and the hotel and service was not as good as at the Mayfair. Covered attended parking 24 hrs. the negatives in some of the reports shown in some reviews were no where to be found...this facility should be treated fairly in its reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a prologned time due to work. The rates were resonable, compared to other hotels. However, because I was monthly, I was not given any toilet paper or towels. Also, I had to wash my own sheets at the laundry down the street (they provide linen, but do not clean them). I did get a frig and microwave (new) which I liked. I also had my own coffe pot! As long as you stay in at night and keep your door locked, you have no problems.
